Key Match Events: Oakland hit three home runs and scored five runs during the 7th and 8th innings to secure a 5-4 win over the Reds.
Fernando Cruz started for the Reds due to a shortage of starting pitchers.
Osvaldo Bido dominated against left-handed hitters, allowing only a .154 batting average and .205 slugging percentage.
The Reds called up left-handed reliever Evan Kravetz from Triple-A.
Rhett Lowder is set to start in Friday's doubleheader against Milwaukee.
The Reds made a comeback in the 7th inning, scoring six runs to take a 6-5 lead.
Wil Benson hit a three-run homer in the 7th inning.
Emilio Pagan gave up four runs in the 8th inning, leading to an 8-6 loss for the Reds.
Pre-Game Insights: The Reds are running out of starting pitchers, leading to the use of relievers as starters.
Fernando Cruz has struggled against left-handed hitters this season.
Osvaldo Bido has been effective against left-handed hitters since being called up by Oakland.
Evan Kravetz was called up from Triple-A due to the Reds' pitching shortage.
Rhett Lowder, a 2023 1st round pick, will start in Friday's doubleheader against Milwaukee.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds showed resilience by coming back from a 5-0 deficit to take a 6-5 lead.
Emilio Pagan's poor performance in the 8th inning was a key factor in the Reds' loss.
The Reds' effort and frustration were evident despite the loss.
The team is facing challenges with injuries and pitching shortages.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Great American Ball Park with a forecast of 80° and cloudy with a 50% chance of rain.
The Reds' playoff odds are very low, at 0.1% according to Fangraphs.
The attendance at the game was notably low, reflecting the team's struggles.
